member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.Registry
member.summary: Provides objects that represent the root keys in the Windows registry, and static methods to access key/value pairs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Defines the types (or classes) of documents and the properties associated with those types. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.CurrentConfig
member.summary: Contains configuration information pertaining to the hardware that is not specific to the user. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.CurrentUser
member.summary: Contains information about the current user preferences. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_USER

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.GetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves the value associated with the specified name, in the specified registry key. If the name is not found in the specified key, returns a default value that you provide, or null if the specified key does not exist.
member.param: The full registry path of the key, beginning with a valid registry root, such as "HKEY_CURRENT_USER".
The name of the name/value pair.
The value to return if valueName does not exist.
member.returns: null if the subkey specified by keyName does not exist; otherwise, the value associated with valueName, or defaultValue if valueName is not found.
member.exception: The user does not have the permissions required to read from the registry key.
The that contains the specified value has been marked for deletion.
keyName does not begin with a valid registry root.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.LocalMachine
member.summary: Contains the configuration data for the local machine. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.PerformanceData
member.summary: Contains performance information for software components. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.SetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the specified name/value pair on the specified registry key. If the specified key does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The full registry path of the key, beginning with a valid registry root, such as "HKEY_CURRENT_USER".
The name of the name/value pair.
The value to be stored.
member.exception: value is null.
keyName does not begin with a valid registry root. -or- keyName is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The is read-only, and thus cannot be written to; for example, it is a root-level node.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or modify registry keys.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.SetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind)
member.summary: Sets the name/value pair on the specified registry key, using the specified registry data type. If the specified key does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The full registry path of the key, beginning with a valid registry root, such as "HKEY_CURRENT_USER".
The name of the name/value pair.
The value to be stored.
The registry data type to use when storing the data.
member.exception: value is null.

keyName does not begin with a valid registry root. -or- keyName is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters). -or- The type of value did not match the registry data type specified by valueKind, therefore the data could not be converted properly.
The is read-only, and thus cannot be written to; for example, it is a root-level node, or the key has not been opened with write access.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or modify registry keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.Users
member.summary: Contains information about the default user configuration. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_USERS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive
member.summary: Represents the possible values for a top-level node on a foreign machine.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.CurrentConfig
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.CurrentUser
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_CURRENT_USER base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.LocalMachine
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.PerformanceData
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.Users
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_USERS base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey
member.summary: Represents a key-level node in the Windows registry. This class is a registry encapsulation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.Close
member.summary: Closes the key and flushes it to disk if its contents have been modified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey for write access.
member.param: The name or path of the subkey to create or open. This string is not case-sensitive.
member.returns: The newly created subkey, or null if the operation failed. If a zero-length string is specified for subkey, the current object is returned.
member.exception: subkey is null.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or open the registry key.
The on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).
The cannot be written to; for example, it was not opened as a writable key , or the user does not have the necessary access rights.
The nesting level exceeds 510. -or- A system error occurred, such as deletion of the key, or an attempt to create a key in the root.

member.param: The name or path of the subkey to create or open. This string is not case-sensitive.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the key is opened for read or read/write access.
member.returns: The newly created subkey, or null if the operation failed. If a zero-length string is specified for subkey, the current object is returned.
member.exception: subkey is null.

permissionCheck contains an invalid value.

The nesting level exceeds 510. -or- A system error occurred, such as deletion of the key, or an attempt to create a key in the root.

true to indicate the new subkey is writable; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.DeleteSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey.

member.exception: The subkey has child subkeys
The subkey parameter does not specify a valid registry key
subkey is null

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.DeleteSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey, and specifies whether an exception is raised if the subkey is not found.
member.param: The name of the subkey to delete. This string is not case-sensitive.

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified subkey cannot be found. If this argument is true and the specified subkey does not exist, an exception is raised. If this argument is false and the specified subkey does not exist, no action is taken.
member.exception: subkey has child subkeys.
subkey does not specify a valid registry key, and throwOnMissingSubKey is true.
subkey is null.
The user does not have the permissions required to delete the key.
The being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).
The user does not have the necessary registry rights.

member.param: The name of the subkey to delete. This string is not case-sensitive.

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified subkey cannot be found. If this argument is true and the specified subkey does not exist, an exception is raised. If this argument is false and the specified subkey does not exist, no action is taken.
member.exception: An attempt was made to delete the root hive of the tree. -or- subkey does not specify a valid registry subkey, and throwOnMissingSubKey is true.
subkey is null.

The user does not have the necessary registry rights.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.View
member.summary: Gets the view that was used to create the registry key.
member.returns: The view that was used to create the registry key. -or- , if no view was used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKeyPermissionCheck
member.summary: Specifies whether security checks are performed when opening registry keys and accessing their name/value pairs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKeyPermissionCheck.Default
member.summary: The registry key inherits the mode of its parent. Security checks are performed when trying to access subkeys or values, unless the parent was opened with or mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKeyPermissionCheck.ReadSubTree
member.summary: Security checks are not performed when accessing subkeys or values. A security check is performed when trying to open the current key, unless the parent was opened with or .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKeyPermissionCheck.ReadWriteSubTree
member.summary: Security checks are not performed when accessing subkeys or values. A security check is performed when trying to open the current key, unless the parent was opened with .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryOptions
member.summary: Specifies options to use when creating a registry key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryOptions.None
member.summary: A non-volatile key. This is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryOptions.Volatile
member.summary: A volatile key. The information is stored in memory and is not preserved when the corresponding registry hive is unloaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeRegistryHandle
member.summary: Represents a safe handle to the Windows registry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeRegistryHandle.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that represents the pre-existing handle to use.
true to reliably release the handle during the finalization phase; false to prevent reliable release.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind
member.summary: Specifies the data types to use when storing values in the registry, or identifies the data type of a value in the registry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.Binary
member.summary: Binary data in any form. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_BINARY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.DWord
member.summary: A 32-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_DWORD.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.ExpandString
member.summary: A null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables, such as %PATH%, that are expanded when the value is retrieved. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_EXPAND_SZ.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.MultiString
member.summary: An array of null-terminated strings, terminated by two null characters. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_MULTI_SZ.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.None
member.summary: No data type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.QWord
member.summary: A 64-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_QWORD.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.String
member.summary: A null-terminated string. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_SZ.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.Unknown
member.summary: An unsupported registry data type. For example, the Microsoft Win32 API registry data type REG_RESOURCE_LIST is unsupported. Use this value to specify that the method should determine the appropriate registry data type when storing a name/value pair.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions
member.summary: Specifies optional behavior when retrieving name/value pairs from a registry key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions.DoNotExpandEnvironmentNames
member.summary: A value of type is retrieved without expanding its embedded environment variables.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions.None
member.summary: No optional behavior is specified.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView
member.summary: Specifies which registry view to target on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView.Default
member.summary: The default view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView.Registry32
member.summary: The 32-bit view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView.Registry64
member.summary: The 64-bit view.

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule
member.summary: Represents a set of access rights allowed or denied for a user or group. This class cannot be inherited.

A bitwise combination of values indicating the rights allowed or denied.
One of the values indicating whether the rights are allowed or denied.

identity is null. -or- eventRights is zero.
identity is neither of type nor of a type such as that can be converted to type .

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule
member.summary: Represents a set of access rights to be audited for a user or group. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule.#ctor(System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference,System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights,System.Security.AccessControl.InheritanceFlags,System.Security.AccessControl.PropagationFlags,System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the user or group to audit, the rights to audit, whether to take inheritance into account, and whether to audit success, failure, or both.

A bitwise combination of values specifying whether the audit rule applies to subkeys of the current key.
A bitwise combination of values that affect the way an inherited audit rule is propagated to subkeys of the current key.
A bitwise combination of values specifying whether to audit success, failure, or both.

identity is null. -or- registryRights is zero.

A bitwise combination of values specifying the kinds of access to audit.

member.name: P:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule.RegistryRights
member.summary: Gets the access rights affected by the audit rule.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of values that indicates the rights affected by the audit rule.

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights
member.summary: Specifies the access control rights that can be applied to registry objects.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: The right to change the access rules and audit rules associated with a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.CreateLink
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.CreateSubKey
member.summary: The right to create subkeys of a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.Delete
member.summary: The right to delete a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.EnumerateSubKeys
member.summary: The right to list the subkeys of a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ExecuteKey
member.summary: Same as .

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.FullControl
member.summary: The right to exert full control over a registry key, and to modify its access rules and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.Notify
member.summary: The right to request notification of changes on a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.QueryValues
member.summary: The right to query the name/value pairs in a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ReadKey
member.summary: The right to query the name/value pairs in a registry key, to request notification of changes, to enumerate its subkeys, and to read its access rules and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: The right to open and copy the access rules and audit rules for a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.SetValue
member.summary: The right to create, delete, or set name/value pairs in a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: The right to change the owner of a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.WriteKey
member.summary: The right to create, delete, and set the name/value pairs in a registry key, to create or delete subkeys, to request notification of changes, to enumerate its subkeys, and to read its access rules and audit rules.

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity
member.summary: Represents the Windows access control security for a registry key. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

member.name: P:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AccessRightType
member.summary: Gets the enumeration type that the class uses to represent access rights.
member.returns: A object representing the enumeration.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AccessRuleFactory(System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Security.AccessControl.InheritanceFlags,System.Security.AccessControl.PropagationFlags,System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType)
member.summary: Creates a new access control rule for the specified user, with the specified access rights, access control, and flags.
member.param: An that identifies the user or group the rule applies to.
A bitwise combination of values specifying the access rights to allow or deny, cast to an integer.
A Boolean value specifying whether the rule is inherited.
A bitwise combination of values specifying how the rule is inherited by subkeys.
A bitwise combination of values that modify the way the rule is inherited by subkeys. Meaningless if the value of inheritanceFlags is .
One of the values specifying whether the rights are allowed or denied.
member.returns: A object representing the specified rights for the specified user.
member.exception: accessMask, inheritanceFlags, propagationFlags, or type specifies an invalid value.
identityReference is null. -or- accessMask is zero.
identityReference is neither of type , nor of a type such as that can be converted to type .

member.name: P:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AccessRuleType
member.summary: Gets the type that the class uses to represent access rules.
member.returns: A object representing the class.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AddAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule)
member.summary: Searches for a matching access control with which the new rule can be merged. If none are found, adds the new rule.
member.param: The access control rule to add.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AddAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule)
member.summary: Searches for an audit rule with which the new rule can be merged. If none are found, adds the new rule.
member.param: The audit rule to add. The user specified by this rule determines the search.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AuditRuleFactory(System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Security.AccessControl.InheritanceFlags,System.Security.AccessControl.PropagationFlags,System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags)
member.summary: Creates a new audit rule, specifying the user the rule applies to, the access rights to audit, the inheritance and propagation of the rule, and the outcome that triggers the rule.
member.param: An that identifies the user or group the rule applies to.
A bitwise combination of values specifying the access rights to audit, cast to an integer.
A Boolean value specifying whether the rule is inherited.
A bitwise combination of values specifying how the rule is inherited by subkeys.
A bitwise combination of values that modify the way the rule is inherited by subkeys. Meaningless if the value of inheritanceFlags is .
A bitwise combination of values specifying whether to audit successful access, failed access, or both.
member.returns: A object representing the specified audit rule for the specified user, with the specified flags. The return type of the method is the base class, , but the return value can be cast safely to the derived class.
member.exception: accessMask, inheritanceFlags, propagationFlags, or flags specifies an invalid value.
identityReference is null. -or- accessMask is zero.
identityReference is neither of type , nor of a type such as that can be converted to type .

member.name: P:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.AuditRuleType
member.summary: Gets the type that the class uses to represent audit rules.
member.returns: A object representing the class.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.RemoveAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule)
member.summary: Searches for an access control rule with the same user and (allow or deny) as the specified access rule, and with compatible inheritance and propagation flags; if such a rule is found, the rights contained in the specified access rule are removed from it.
member.param: A that specifies the user and to search for, and a set of inheritance and propagation flags that a matching rule, if found, must be compatible with. Specifies the rights to remove from the compatible rule, if found.
member.returns: true if a compatible rule is found; otherwise false.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.RemoveAccessRuleAll(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule)
member.summary: Searches for all access control rules with the same user and (allow or deny) as the specified rule and, if found, removes them.
member.param: A that specifies the user and to search for. Any rights, inheritance flags, or propagation flags specified by this rule are ignored.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.RemoveAccessRuleSpecific(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule)
member.summary: Searches for an access control rule that exactly matches the specified rule and, if found, removes it.
member.param: The to remove.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.RemoveAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule)
member.summary: Searches for an audit control rule with the same user as the specified rule, and with compatible inheritance and propagation flags; if a compatible rule is found, the rights contained in the specified rule are removed from it.
member.param: A that specifies the user to search for, and a set of inheritance and propagation flags that a matching rule, if found, must be compatible with. Specifies the rights to remove from the compatible rule, if found.
member.returns: true if a compatible rule is found; otherwise, false.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.RemoveAuditRuleAll(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule)
member.summary: Searches for all audit rules with the same user as the specified rule and, if found, removes them.
member.param: A that specifies the user to search for. Any rights, inheritance flags, or propagation flags specified by this rule are ignored.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.RemoveAuditRuleSpecific(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule)
member.summary: Searches for an audit rule that exactly matches the specified rule and, if found, removes it.
member.param: The to be removed.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.ResetAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule)
member.summary: Removes all access control rules with the same user as the specified rule, regardless of , and then adds the specified rule.
member.param: The to add. The user specified by this rule determines the rules to remove before this rule is added.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.SetAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAccessRule)
member.summary: Removes all access control rules with the same user and (allow or deny) as the specified rule, and then adds the specified rule.
member.param: The to add. The user and of this rule determine the rules to remove before this rule is added.
member.exception: rule is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistrySecurity.SetAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryAuditRule)
member.summary: Removes all audit rules with the same user as the specified rule, regardless of the value, and then adds the specified rule.
member.param: The to add. The user specified by this rule determines the rules to remove before this rule is added.
member.exception: rule is null.
